copyBlock.copy: Small riding lawn mowers are ideal for getting the job done quicker than a walk-behind lawn mower while helping to minimize the space needed to store the unit. The 30-in. deck size allows easy maneuverability in tight areas and is engineered to fit through most standard-sized garden gates and doors. A small riding lawn mower is a practical solution for homeowners with limited storage space.

blocks.title: TB30B Small Riding Lawn Mower
blocks.copy: The Troy-Bilt® TB30B Gas Powered Riding Lawn Mower combines the time savings benefit of a riding mower with the storage size of a wide-cut walk behind mower. Its space-saving design makes the mower easy to store in garages and sheds.

blocks.title: TB30E XP Small Riding Lawn Mower
blocks.copy:
The TB30E XP brings the same storage benefits of its gas counterpart, but with a lithium-ion powered 56V MAX* battery and two brushless motors designed for reliable performance.
* Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 56 volts. Nominal voltage is 50.4 volts

powerLevel.h2: Power on a Whole New Level

blocks.title: GAS POWER
blocks.copy: Gas-powered engines provide powerful performance with simple starting, easy operation, and quick refueling.

blocks.title: Electric POWER
blocks.copy: Troy-Bilt’s lithium-ion battery technology delivers reliable runtime with minimal power fade, quiet operation, and less maintenance when compared to its gas counterpart.

quote.title: Great Mower
quote.copy: “…So many good things to say about it I don't know where to start. It turns on a dime, really has more than enough power, easy to operate and really not that much more than a good self-propelled walk behind mower. It also easily fits through my gate to go from my back to front yard. I did get the optional grass catcher especially for the autumn leaves season. Can't say enough about the quality either. Try it you'll like it!!”
quote.name: Sselle

forEveryJob.copy: Your riding lawn mower can be used for more than just cutting grass with a variety of attachments and accessories available to help make yardwork easy. Each sold separately.

blocks.title: Bagger System
blocks.copy: A double bag grass collection system mounts easily to your lawn mower to collect grass clippings while mowing. The vented nylon bags provide airflow and strength to help prevent grass from clogging.

blocks.title: Hauler
blocks.copy: Built with fold-out side panels for easy loading and unloading and designed to carry up to 800 pounds, the hauler allows you to move logs and mulch easily.

blocks.title: Armrest Kit
blocks.copy: To help make you comfortable while seated, these armrests are designed to provide support for your arms while you're mowing. When not in use, the armrest flips up to move out of the way.

blocks.title: How to Change the Air Filter on a Riding Mower
blocks.copy: This is how you remove and replace the air filter of a Troy-Bilt riding lawn mower with a Kohler Engine. Always be sure to check your owner's manual for detailed instructions on how to change the air filter of your riding lawn tractor.

blocks.copy: This video will show you how to replace the blades on this Troy-Bilt riding mower.  Depending on your model, the instructions in this video may vary slightly.  Always be sure to check your operator's manual for detailed instructions.

blocks.copy: Regular oil changes are critical to keeping your riding lawn mower's engine in top shape and prolonging the life of your mower. Watch this video to learn how to change the oil...

blocks.copy: Just because it's winter, doesn't mean you won't be using your riding lawn mower. Whether hauling wood or clearing the drive with the snow thrower attachment, your machine can be a vital asset...

faqs.question: Can you use a riding mower on a small yard?
faqs.answer: A small riding lawn mower can significantly speed up the mowing process compared to a standard 21-in. push mower. The 30-inch cutting width vs. a standard 21-in. walk-behind deck helps provide more ground coverage per pass thus improving productivity and making the maintenance of your small yard manageable. Riding mowers are suitable for small yards, particularly those that are one-half acre in size or larger.

faqs.question: What type of mower is recommended for a half acre?
faqs.answer: Both small riding lawn mowers and are viable options for a half-acre yard. If you prefer a seated position and want to cover the area quickly, a small riding lawn mower can also be a suitable choice. It provides comfort and convenience while navigating the yard. Troy-Bilt offers two small riding lawn mowers, the TB30B, and the TB30E XP. Self-propelled mowers feature front or rear-powered wheels that aide in maneuvering around the yard and help alleviate some of the physical effort required. They offer a convenient solution for maintaining a half-acre lawn efficiently.

faqs.question: Is a riding mower worth it for a half acre?
faqs.answer: A riding mower offers several advantages for yards of a half-acre, including enhanced efficiency and reduced cutting time compared to a walk-behind mower. By opting for a riding mower with a 30-inch deck, you can speed up the mowing process and cover more ground with each pass compared to a residential walk-behind mower with a cutting deck smaller than 30 in. Troy-Bilt offers two small riding lawn mowers, the TB30B, and the TB30E XP. The increased cutting width allows for faster coverage and improved productivity, making the maintenance of your half-acre lawn more manageable. Both models are equipped with a hitch that offers light towing capabilities and a mulch plug that helps prevent grass from escaping the machine, enabling it to be finely chopped into smaller pieces for use as lawn fertilizer. Investing in a riding mower can be a worthwhile choice.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of a small riding lawn mower?
faqs.answer:
A compact design makes small riding lawn mowers highly maneuverable for easy navigation around tight corners and through small gates. Benefits of the Troy-Bilt TB30B and TB30E XP specifically include:
  • Easy storage, fitting in the space of two garbage cans.
  • Ability to mow through a 36-inch gate doorway.
  • Rear engine battery location allows for a better line of sight with an unobstructed view while mowing compared to a lawn tractor.

faqs.question: What is the smallest riding mower?
faqs.answer: The smallest riding lawn mowers available in the Troy-Bilt® lineup are the TB30B, and the TB30E XP models. Both feature a compact design, a 30-in. cutting deck and are capable of efficiently navigating tight spaces. The TB30B is a gas powered model while the TB30B XP runs on a lithium-ion battery platform.
